item.title: Blog reincarnation
item.description: As it was before Once upon a time, at the very beginning, the site worked on my own Alroniks CMS, then there was the Dockpad static sites generator (the project died) after there was an attempt to launch the site on MODX, but it was unsuccessful.

item.title: Dukora and the upside-down house
item.description: At the weekend we decided to go somewhere with the child and decided to go to the village Dukora, which is not far from Minsk. This is one of several famous estates in the vicinity of Minsk. At the entrance, there is a restored gateway, inside which there are a cash register and a souvenir shop.

item.title: Amsterdam and a trip to the conference
item.description: In March, I was invited to speak at the MODX rally in Amsterdam. He threw things in his backpack and drove off. The trip was not the easiest, ** five ** flights in 3 days! The trip was purely working, I prepared a report along the way, mounted a podcast, and did other routine things, so there wasn’t much time around to look.

item.title: The MODX Technical Vision
item.description: It is the second speech in English and almost without preparation, but extraordinarily emotional and honest.

item.title: Druskininkai and Anastas Cesnulis Park
item.description: In mid-March, we decided to organize a weekend tour and go to a water park in Druskininkai, Lithuania. I was on vacation, so I chose a weekday for the trip to avoid queues at the border, which happen regularly. The weather was not the most pleasant, with slight nasty rain, but the sun sometimes still glanced, and we managed to walk a little in the neighborhood.

item.title: MODX 3: What's New?
item.description: Speech in Russian on MODX Meetup Minsk in 2018.

item.title: How to contribute to MODX
item.description: Original talk in Russian, but I attached a link to the translated version of the talk. It was the speech at the biggest international MODX conference – MODXpo 2017, that I held in Minsk.

item.title: Development of MODX sites in PHPStorm
item.description: Speech in Russian on MODX Meetup Kazakhstan in 2017 in Almaty.

item.title: Narrow topic meetup: how not to screw up
item.description: I was invited to the non-technical meetup “The art of organizing events” to share my experience in hosting meetups of our local community, built around MODX. The speech was in Russian.

item.title: Gitify as a Swiss knife for MODX warrior
item.description: Speech in Russian on MODX Meetup Minsk in 2015.

item.title: E-Commerce and the miniShop2 Ecosystem
item.description: My first speech in English and for people outside our local community, as well, it was the first international conference where I was lucky to speak. I am proud that I did it at that time. Unfortunately, video was not recorded.

item.title: Results and facts for 2014
item.description: I borrowed a note template from Artem Sapegin. So, some facts, events, and achievements in 2014: I figured out the DocPad generator and created my website in two languages. Also, I sent a couple of pull requests to DocPad itself.

item.title: MODX Teleportation
item.description: Speech in Russian on MODX Meetup Minsk in 2014.

item.title: MODX Cooking Recipes
item.description: My first public speech, in Russian, on local meetup “PHP Saturday” held by Ciklum.

item.title: Favicon appeared on the website
item.description: Well-known to everyone, Favicon is the sign of the quality of the site at the moment. If anyone does not know, it is a small icon in the browser line to the left of the page address. Also, in various catalogs and applications, these icons are shown.

item.title: New website design
item.description: As you may have noticed, dear readers, the work is not standing still. I do things all the time, and I change stuff on the site. I created the website recently, and these changes are logical. The section is called “Blog News,” and it is in this section that I am going to tell you about new features and features of my site and blog.

item.title: The first note in the blog
item.description: Hello! By this post, I want to start my blog. First, I want to tell you what I’m going to write about in my blog, for whom I’m going to write and how often and why I don’t use ready-made services like LiveJournal.

item.title: Donate Manifesto
item.description: I started my blog 10 years ago to talk about the technology I work with and also to share my thoughts about the world. Over the past 10 years I have gained experience both professionally and in life, and now I have a lot to talk about.
